availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Calvert Foy (Covington, Kenton County, Kentucky, stable keeper and officer (U.S.A.))

body.p: Covington, Kenton County, Kentucky, stable keeper and soldier. Washington, D.C., native. Married to Francis Foy. Father of Ada Foy. Livery stable keeper in Covington, Kentucky in 1860. Employed Nancy Lovelace in Covington, Kentucky in 1860. Served in 23rd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as captain from December 16, 1861 to July 24, 1864. Died in military service near Atlanta, Georgia on July 24, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington, p. 666.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 132.
